verses.roman:
airāvata-kulebhāṁś ca
catur-dantāṁs tarasvinaḥ
pāṇḍurāṁś ca catuḥ-ṣaṣṭiṁ
prerayām āsa keśavaḥ

synonyms: airāvata—of Airāvata, Lord Indra's carrier; kula—from the family; ibhān—elephants; ca—also; catuḥ—four; dantān—having tusks; tarasvinaḥ—swift; pāṇḍurān—white; ca—and; catuḥ-ṣaṣṭim—sixty-four; prerayām āsa—dispatched; keśavaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa.
translation: Lord Kṛṣṇa also dispatched sixty-four swift white elephants, descendants of Airāvata, who each sported four tusks.
